[center][color=#FFff00][size=\\\"8\\\"]Drakespire Mages Guild[/size][/color]
Requires Skyrim Latest version[/center]

[center]You may also want to know this is my first Mod, yes I\'m a noob.[/center]


====================================================================


[color=#007FFF]Location
========[/color]
Drakespire itself is located south-east of Windhelm in the mountains above Kynesgrove. You can not access it though until you become Archmage of Winterhold, and then only thru the Archmages Quarters at the College until you aquire the needed Key to gain Access to the Secret external Entrance.

[color=#007FFF]Details
=======[/color]
Drakespire is the home of the secret organization dedicated to stopping the Thalmor. Once you become Archmage of the College of Winterhold, you also become the leader of Drakespire and gain access to it\'s entrance. Drakespire comes with it\'s own story line, lore friendly history, Npc\'s, Merchants, and Quests. Think of it as a secret extention to the College of Winterhold, that is dedicated to stopping the Thalmor threat.

Drakespire can be used as a simple player home, for those just looking for a better Archmages Quarters, by the quick access from the balcony once you complete the short Intro Quest. You can travel to Drakespire very rapidly, through magic portals in minutes, not days.  

Drakespire has everything a hold would have, an Alchemy Merchant, Blacksmith, Priestess, Innkeeper, Cook, Spell Merchant, Trainer, Horse Merchant, Guards and a Bard. Along with thier family in some cases.

Drakespire also comes with Agents, Trainees and Clerks, that can all be used as followers. Some Agents wont be active until you complete one of the Quests. Being the leader of Drakespire also comes with the perk of having your own private guard besides the normal guards. Your private guards can also be used as followers, and as with most NPC\'s within Drakespire are also marriable if you choose.

As of version 1 there are two quest, not including the short Intro. I don\'t believe in a lot of hand holding, so the first real quest wont be given to you, you have to find it yourself. I recommend reading notes and looking around to figure out whats up.

The Drakespire area itself comes with your own private tower complex which includes your private Quarters, which has a shower and bath. Your own private Trophy room with mannequins, and weapons cases. Your own private Carfting room and garden, with both Alchemy and Enchanting tables. You also have access to the smithing crafting area in the Armory, along with more Mannequins that are safe for your use.

Drakespire also comes with it\'s own Library, Jail, Banquet Hall/Tavern, Kitchen, Temple, and Training Hall, explore and have fun. There are little presents located thru most area\'s of Drakespire for the taking.

Drakespire Agents can be found in the War Room, or depending on the time of day, they might be in the Banquet Hall eating or in the Living Area/Barracks Sleeping or relaxing. The War Room is also the default location they return to when you complete the quest they might be tied too.

Guards are on patrol both day and night in the common area\'s of Drakespire, and yes, will arrest even the Archmage if he commits a crime in thier presence. Your Private Guard takes over the security duties above the Library Level of the Archmages Tower Complex though. 


[color=#ADD8E6]So why make this Mod?
===============[/color]

This all started originaly while I was looking for a good replacement for the Archmages Quarters. I was very let down by the current one and ran across mgbeaches Drakespire office, so I have to give credit to him for making me think, the cool name and for getting the ball rolling.

I started this project as my first ever mod by just trying to add on to what he started, but soon had to scrap it all thru first time errors in modding. I then started from scratch and it just kept growing. Every time I thought I was close to being done I thought of a new area I wanted to learn how to make or a new NPC that I wanted to make, then I thought it would be cool to have a quest, Sansha\'s Only Hope. So after days and weeks spent on the Mod I then thought, where\'s this all going... I HATE the Thalmor, wouldn\'t it be cool to mess with them? Then I had to add Justiciar Keep and its Quest.

So after hundreds of hours spent working on the mod, watching youtube tutorials, reading tutorials and experimenting I have what I hope is a good beta release version. I have listened to experienced modders... and I have tried my best to not make this mod conflict with others, but now I need your help in testing to see how it does. I have played thru it more times than I can count testing it, but never with other mods running. This was done since I didn\'t want any leak over from other mods corrupting what I was creating by getting meshes, textures, etc. mixed up before I archived it for upload.

And, while I have my own preferences for mods, I made everything vanilla. This was hard with the Npc\'s, I really wanted to add hair and body mods to them, but restrained myself so you can add your own personal touches.

1.0 Initial beta release for testing. 
- This is a work in progress as I plan on you all finding bugs I need to fix, and I will do my best to stay on it and try to fix anything you find in a timely manner.

That being said, if you just don\'t like something creatively speaking, then feel free to make your own mod. 

It\'s what I did.

=======[/color]
Skyrim.esm
Update.esm



[color=#7FFF00]Installation
=======[/color]


Just use NMM to install, or:

1. Extract the files to a temporary location.
2. Examine the folder structure and make corrections where necessary.
3. Copy files to (Skyrim install folder)\\\\Data\\\\


[color=#ADD8E6]Uninstallation
=======[/color]

Just use NMM or remove the files manually.



[color=#CD0000]Known Issues or Bugs
====================[/color]

Intro Quest Bug:

Since the last update, thanks Bethesda, if you load this mod after completing the College Quest line the Drakespire Intro Quest has a bug with the courier. There is now a delay in the note getting into the couriers container, so he may show up and just say the first two lines and then nothing. If this happens, just fast travel somewhere else and kill some time, two or three minutes should be fine, then the next time he comes up to you in a town the dialogue will work. This should not be a problem if you install mod before finishing College Quest line as the note will have time to propagate into the WICourier container before the Quest starts.

Some players experienced issues with this mods size on the first two versions, 1.0 and 1.1, but I have now cut out all the unused resorces and hope it helps. Please keep the feedback coming so I know if it worked. 



[color=#EEEE00]Incompatibilities
===============[/color]

This will be incompatible with anything that uses the two cells in the mountains just up the slope from the hunters camp above Kynesgrove, and the cell just west of the dragon wordwall located south of Riften in the mountains.

This may be incompatible with mods that alter the cells in the holds due to the portals, but I tried to keep the portals out of the way and in unused areas to prevent conflicts.

This Mod will probably also conflict with any mod that changes the Archmages Quarters in the College.

Hopefully there will not be any more than this, but that\'s why it\'s beta... let me know.

[color=#ADD8E6]Permissions
=======[/color]

DO NOT simply alter this mod and repackage it as your own, give me a little credit too. I know there are better modders out there than me since I\'m a noob. 

Give credit if including it in your own projects, and let me know so I can check out your awesome work. 

Do not upload this mod to another site without permission.  That being said, if you would like to translate this mod to your native language, please fill free to do so if you only upload it to Nexus.
